title: 108_hr3406
content: Amendments are being made to the Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997. The Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997 is being amended to define the term "Foundation" as the Oklahoma City National Memorial Foundation, a not-for-profit corporation. The Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997 is being amended to change the administration of the Memorial by the Foundation. The Foundation will now administer the Memorial in accordance with the Act and the Memorial Mission Statement. The Memorial Mission Statement was adopted in 1996 by the Foundation. Section 5 of the Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997 is amended to transfer Memorial Property, Rights, Authorities, and Duties to the Foundation. The Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997 is amended to transfer Memorial Property, Rights, Authorities, and Duties to the Foundation. The Oklahoma City National Memorial Act Amendments of 2003 require the Trust to transfer all assets, properties, and intellectual property of the Memorial to the Foundation within 90 days of enactment. The Oklahoma City National Memorial Act Amendments of 2003 mandate the Trust to transfer all Memorial property, rights, and duties to the Foundation. Any subsequent gifts received by the Trust will also belong to the Foundation. Obligations approved by the Trust before the transfer date will become the responsibility of the Foundation. The Trust must dissolve within 30 days of the property transfer. The Trust must dissolve within 30 days of transferring all Memorial property, rights, and duties to the Foundation. The Secretary can enter agreements with the Foundation for interpretive services related to the Memorial. State and local law enforcement can be used for security at the Memorial. Section 6 of the Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997 is repealed. The Memorial Act of 1997 is repealed, with the effective date upon the transfer of property. Amendments are made to the Oklahoma City National Memorial Act, authorizing appropriations for an endowment fund. The Secretary is authorized to reimburse previous costs paid by the Foundation or Trust. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to reimburse the Oklahoma City National Memorial Foundation for interpretive services, security, and other related costs. $1,500,000 is authorized to be appropriated for this purpose. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to reimburse the Oklahoma City National Memorial Foundation for interpretive services, security, and related costs with $1,500,000 appropriated. Sections 8 and 9 of the Oklahoma City National Memorial Act of 1997 are repealed.
